title: Citi, the Mets and the Mets Alumni Association Presented by Citi Team Up with City Harvest to Fight Hunger at Citi Field
summary: New York – Citi and the New York Mets are teaming up with City Harvest tonight to fight hunger, prior to the Mets hosting the Atlanta Braves at 7:10 p.m. at Citi Field. Forty Citi and Mets volunteers will work alongside those from City Harvest to repackage more than 25,000 pounds of potatoes on Mets Plaza starting at 3:45 p.m. Members of the Mets Alumni Association Presented by Citi, including Rick Aguilera, Dennis Cook, Cleon Jones, Jim McAndrews, Doug Sisk and John Stearns, will be on hand.
tag-1: Citi, the Mets and the Mets Alumni Association Presented by Citi Team Up with City Harvest to Fight Hunger at Citi Field
tag-3: New York – Citi and the New York Mets are teaming up with City Harvest tonight to fight hunger, prior to the Mets hosting the Atlanta Braves at 7:10 p.m. at Citi Field. Forty Citi and Mets volunteers will work alongside those from City Harvest to repackage more than 25,000 pounds of potatoes on Mets Plaza starting at 3:45 p.m. Members of the Mets Alumni Association Presented by Citi, including Rick Aguilera, Dennis Cook, Cleon Jones, Jim McAndrews, Doug Sisk and John Stearns, will be on hand.
tag-4: The world's first food rescue organization, City Harvest is dedicated to feeding New York City's hungry. The organization collects excess food from all segments of the food industry and delivers it to soup kitchens and food pantries throughout the five boroughs.
tag-5: The Mets Alumni Association Presented by Citi was created in 2010 to expand financial inclusion and economic empowerment in local underserved communities while honoring Mets history. In partnership with Citi Community Development and local non-profit organizations, former Mets players participate in various special events throughout the year as part of this initiative.
tag-6: "Giving back and celebrating the spirit of volunteerism is an important part of our commitment to citizenship," Eileen Auld, Region Director New York/Connecticut of Citi Community Development. "Citi employees volunteer in communities where they work and live and that dedication to making an impact is as strong as ever here today. We are thrilled to work alongside such great partners like the Mets and City Harvest to make a difference."
tag-7: Additionally, the Mets Alumni and Citi executives will present City Harvest volunteer Chloe Jacobs with the "Teammates in the Community Award" during a special pre-game ceremony. The award recognizes individuals who have demonstrated extraordinary ways to give back to the community, and Jacobs will be honored for her exemplary commitment and dedication to serving and helping others. Jacobs has initiated her work place's participation in Skip Lunch Fight Hunger, a fundraiser to help City Harvest feed hungry kids and families over the summer as well as an annual Thanksgiving fundraiser for the organization. She has played a key role in City Harvest volunteer opportunities such as distributing fresh produce to hungry New Yorkers at Mobile Markets and leading teams to rescue food following large food shows. She also led her firm to participate in City Harvest's Street Fleet program, in which corporate volunteers pick up excess food from City Harvest donors and deliver it to City Harvest agencies on a weekly basis.
tag-8: "Our partner emergency food programs tell us that they need more fresh produce, but they are sometimes unable to accept and store it in the large quantities we receive at City Harvest. We're grateful to volunteers from Citi and the Mets for devoting this afternoon to making sure this donation of potatoes can be delivered and distributed to hungry families as early as tonight," said Jilly Stephens, executive director of City Harvest.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
tag-10: Citi Community Development Citi Community Development (CCD) is leading Citi's commitment to achieve economic empowerment and growth for underserved individuals, families and communities by expanding access to financial products and services, and building sustainable business solutions and innovative partnerships. Our focus areas include: commercial and philanthropic funding; innovative financial products and services; and collaborations with institutions that expand access to financial products and services for low-income and underserved communities. For more information, please visit www.citigroup.com/community.
tag-11: City Harvest Now serving New York City for more than 25 years, City Harvest (www.CityHarvest.org) is the world's first food rescue organization, dedicated to feeding the city's hungry men, women, and children. This year, City Harvest will collect over 28 million pounds of excess food from all segments of the food industry, including restaurants, grocers, corporate cafeterias, manufacturers, and farms. This food is then delivered free of charge to nearly 600 community food programs throughout New York City using a fleet of trucks and bikes as well as volunteers on foot. Each week, City Harvest helps over 300,000 hungry New Yorkers find their next meal.
